page.title: 01South side of Loch Fleet
page.content: There are two large farms on the coast of the mixed type. Barley, oats, grass, sheep and beef cattle. There are few crofts on the upper land growing similar things. The two small forestry plantations are mainoy of Sitka and Larch. A pleasant walk has been made through Skello wood. Loch Fleet is a large estuary with extensive mud flats at low tide nd many types of waders and sea birds can be found here. In June and July salmon can be seen heading up river, though numbers have declined in recent years. Also the occasional grey seal looking for fish. The hospital at Cambusarie was bult for TB patients,but is now used for geriatrics.
